intro: Lasiandra obscura, commonly known as the dark lasiandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its foliage is gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. Lasiandra obscura is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
